verses.verse: (Prayer to Frustrate Conspiracy Against Israel) A Song. A Psalm of Asaph. [1] Do (Ps. 28:1) not keep silent, O God! Do not hold Your peace, And do not be still, O God!
For behold, (Ps. 81:15; Is. 17:12; Acts 4:25) Your enemies make a tumult; And those who hate You have lifted up their head.
They have taken crafty counsel against Your people, And consulted together ((Ps. 27:5)) against Your sheltered ones.
They have said, “Come, and (Esth. 3:6, 9; Jer. 11:19; 31:36) let us cut them off from being a nation, That the name of Israel may be remembered no more.”
For they have consulted together with one consent; They form a confederacy against You:
(2 Chr. 20:1, 10, 11) The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; Moab and the Hagrites;
Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;
Assyria also has joined with them; They have helped the children of Lot. Selah
Deal with them as with (Num. 31:7; Judg. 7:22) Midian, As with (Judg. 4:15-24; 5:20, 21) Sisera, As with Jabin at the Brook Kishon,
Who perished at En Dor, (Zeph. 1:17) Who became as refuse on the earth.
Make their nobles like (Judg. 7:25) Oreb and like Zeeb, Yes, all their princes like (Judg. 8:12-21) Zebah and Zalmunna,
Who said, “Let us take for ourselves The pastures of God for a possession.”
(Is. 17:13) O my God, make them like the whirling dust, (Job 21:18; Ps. 35:5; Is. 40:24; Jer. 13:24) Like the chaff before the wind!
As the fire burns the woods, And as the flame (Ex. 19:18; Deut. 32:22) sets the mountains on fire,
So pursue them with Your tempest, And frighten them with Your storm.
Fill their faces with shame, That they may seek Your name, O LORD.
Let them be confounded and dismayed forever; Yes, let them be put to shame and perish,
(Ps. 59:13) That they may know that You, whose (Ex. 6:3) name alone is the LORD, Are ((Ps. 92:8)) the Most High over all the earth.
